page.title: 10CHURCHES
page.content: The only church in the area is St John's Church of England. It is the Parish Church for part of Roundhay and the Ladywood area. Built in 1826 from local stone it is stituated close to the A58 Wetherby Road. The spire has a clock with a blue face and Roman numerals. The two main doors are oak, and there are several stained glass windows within the walls. The old churchyard is in front of the church, and the new churchyard on the hillside behind. It is surrounded by trees, with wild flowers, birds, foxes, rabbits and squirrels inhabiting the grounds. Three services are held every Sunday - Holy Communion, Matins and Evensong. The vicarage is in Oakwood Grove, and the parochial hall in Fitzroy Drive, Oakwood.
